column1: Health Table 4. Mental Health Activities in the Last 4 Weeks, by Select Characteristics: United States
Source: U.S. Census Bureau Household Pulse Survey, Week 40.
Note: These data are experimental. Users should take caution using estimates based on subpopulations of the data – sample sizes may be small and the standard errors may be large.**

column3: Received counseling or therapy from a mental health professional such as a psychiatrist, psychologist, psychiatric nurse, or clinical social worker
column6: Needed counseling or therapy from a mental health professional, but did not get it for any reason
column9: Took prescription medication to help with any emotions or with your concentration, behavior or mental health

column1: Hispanic or Latino (may be of any race)
Two or more races + Other races, not Hispanic
7 or more people in the household
Presence of children under 18 years old
Respondent or household member experienced loss of employment income in last 4 weeks
Respondent employed in the last 7 days
Used in the last 7 days to meet spending needs*
Regular income sources like those received before the pandemic
Money from savings or selling assets or possessions (including withdrawals from retirement accounts)
Money saved from deferred or forgiven payments (to meet spending needs)
Serving in Reserve or National Guard
Spouse serving in Reserve or National Guard
No active duty service (self or spouse)
* Totals may not sum to 100% as the question allowed for multiple categories to be marked.

** The Census Bureau considers estimated coefficients of variation (standard error divided by the estimate times 100) over 30 percent to indicate potentially serious data quality issues related to sampling error.
